sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"相信，信任"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: belief, faith, confidence, conviction, credit, trust
means: belief ： 普通用词，指单纯从主观上的相信，不着重这种相信是否有根据。
faith ： 语气较强，强调完全相信；有时也能仅凭感觉产生的相信。
confidence ： 指对某人某事有充分信心，断定不会使人失望，因而给予信任。
conviction ： 多指根据长期交往或实践，对某人某事有了认识和了解后产生的信心和相信，侧重其坚定性。
credit ： 语气最弱，着重以声誉为信任的基础。
trust ： 强调相信、信任的完全可靠。

word_mean: 欧洲货币辛迪加贷款利息

sentence.Network_en: Make a note of credit card numbers and check expiry dates.
sentence.Network_cn: 记下信用卡卡号，核对有效期限。

sentence.Network_cn: 买主们千方百计想从供货商那儿无息赊购。

sentence.Network_en: You're a nice girl, Lettie, and your kind heart does you credit.
sentence.Network_cn: 你是个好女孩儿，莱蒂，你的善良值得称赞。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of an account) have money in it
praise given when it is deserved, even if one is reluctant to give it
jx.jx_cn_mean: （立即或勉强地）给予应得荣誉

phrase.cizu_name: do someone credit (或 do credit to someone)

jx.jx_en_mean: make someone worthy of praise or respect
jx.jx_cn_mean: 为某人增光；给某人带来荣誉

lj.lj_ls: 你的关切增加了你的威信。

jx.jx_en_mean: commend someone for (a quality or achievement), especially with reluctance or surprise
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指犹豫地或惊讶地）称赞某人；肯定某人（的品质或成就）

lj.lj_ly: please give me credit for some sense.
he has 65 Tournament wins to his credit.

jx.jx_en_mean: with an arrangement to pay later
as a good aspect of the situation
jx.jx_cn_mean: 作为好的方面；从好的方面说

lj.lj_ly: on the credit side, the text is highly readable.
lj.lj_ls: 好的方面来说，这篇课文可读性很强。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that something praiseworthy has been achieved, especially despite difficulties
jx.jx_cn_mean: 值得表扬的是（尤指克服困难做成了值得赞扬的事）

lj.lj_ly: to their credit, both sides managed to overcome the elements and produce an exciting match.
lj.lj_ls: 值得表扬的是，双方克服了恶劣天气的影响，进行了一场精彩的比赛。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (originally in the senses 'belief', 'credibility'): from French crédit, probably via Italian credito from Latin creditum, neuter past participle of credere 'believe, trust'

entry.def: If you are allowed credit, you are allowed to pay for goods or services several weeks or months after you have received them.

example.ex: The group can't get credit to buy farming machinery...
example.tran: 这些人无法赊购到农用机械。

example.ex: You can ask a dealer for a discount whether you pay cash or buy on credit.
example.tran: 无论是付现还是赊购，都可以要求经销商打折。

entry.def: If someone or their bank account is in credit, their bank account has money in it.

example.ex: The idea that I could be charged when I'm in credit makes me very angry...
example.tran: 想到账户里有余额时还要收费，我就非常气愤。

example.ex: I made sure the account stayed in credit...
example.tran: 我确保账户里有余额。

entry.def: When a sum of money is credited to an account, the bank adds that sum of money to the total in the account.

example.ex: She noticed that only $80,000 had been credited to her account...
example.tran: 她注意到自己的账户里只存进了80,000美元。

example.ex: Midland decided to change the way it credited payments to accounts...
example.tran: 米兰银行决定改变付款贷记的方式。

entry.def: A credit is a sum of money which is added to an account.

example.ex: The statement of total debits and credits is known as a balance.
example.tran: 总借记和总贷记的结算即账户余额。

entry.def: A credit is an amount of money that is given to someone.

example.ex: Senator Bill Bradley outlined his own tax cut, giving families $350 in tax credits per child...
example.tran: 比尔·布拉德利参议员概述了自己的减税计划，提出每个孩子可为家庭减免350美元的课税。

example.ex: Japan has provided about $2.5 billion in credits to Russia and about $50 million in direct aid.
example.tran: 日本向俄罗斯提供了约25亿美元的借款和价值约5,000万美元的直接援助。

entry.def: If you get the credit for something good, people praise you because you are responsible for it, or are thought to be responsible for it.

example.ex: We don't mind who gets the credit so long as we don't get the blame...
example.tran: 谁受到表扬无所谓，只要我们不挨批就好。

example.ex: It would be wrong for us to take all the credit...
example.tran: 如果我们把所有功劳都揽到自己身上，那就不对了。

entry.def: If people credit someone with an achievement or if it is credited to them, people say or believe that they were responsible for it.

example.ex: The staff are crediting him with having saved Hythe's life...
example.tran: 职员们称赞他救了海丝的命。

example.ex: The 74-year-old mayor is credited with helping make Los Angeles the financial capital of the West Coast...
example.tran: 洛杉矶成为西海岸的金融中心，那位74岁的市长功不可没。

entry.def: If you credit someone with a quality, you believe or say that they have it.

example.ex: I wonder why you can't credit him with the same generosity of spirit...
example.tran: 我想知道你为什么不认为他具有同样崇高的思想境界。

example.ex: They are crediting science with power it doesn't possess.
example.tran: 他们过分夸大了科学的力量。

entry.tran: 为…赢得好感的人(或事物)
entry.def: If you say that someone is a credit to someone or something, you mean that their qualities or achievements will make people have a good opinion of the person or thing mentioned.

example.ex: He is one of the greatest British players of recent times and is a credit to his profession.
example.tran: 他是近代英国最伟大的运动员之一，是这一体育运动的骄傲。

entry.def: If you cannot credit something, you cannot believe that it is true.

example.ex: Roosevelt either did not learn of the scandal or refused to credit what he heard...
example.tran: 罗斯福要么是不知道那桩丑闻，要么是不相信他所听到的。

example.ex: It seems hard to credit that such things went on among senior Directors.
example.tran: 高级主管中竟发生了这样的事，真是令人难以置信。

entry.tran: 演职员表;摄制人员名单
entry.def: The list of people who helped to make a film, a CD, or a television  programme is called the credits .

example.ex: The star Marlon Brando wants his name removed from the credits.
example.tran: 影星马龙·白兰度要求把他的名字从演职员表中删掉。

example.ex: ...a moviegoer who remains in his seat until the credits are over.
example.tran: 直到演职员表播完才离座的影迷

entry.tran: (某些大学获得学位所必需的)学分，学习单元
entry.def: A credit is a successfully completed part of a higher education course. At some universities and colleges you need a certain number of credits to be awarded a degree.
If you say that something does someone credit, you mean that they should be praised or admired because of it.

example.ex: You're a nice girl, Lettie, and your kind heart does you credit.
example.tran: 你是个好女孩儿，莱蒂，你的善良值得称赞。

entry.tran: （某人的成绩或优点）值得表扬，应予肯定
entry.def: If you say 'credit where credit's due', you are admitting that you ought to praise someone for something that they have done or for a good quality that they possess.

example.ex: His gift was an extremely kind gesture. Credit where credit's due.
example.tran: 他的礼物是很友好的表示，这值得称赞。

entry.tran: 相信…具有(某种优良品质);称赞;认可
entry.def: To give someone credit for a good quality means to believe that they have it.

example.ex: Bratbakk had more ability than the media gave him credit for.
example.tran: 布拉特巴克比媒体称赞的要有才华。

entry.tran: (常用于提出缺点之后)就优点而言
entry.def: You say on the credit side in order to introduce one or more good things about a situation or person, usually when you have already mentioned the bad things about them.

example.ex: On the credit side, he's always been wonderful with his mother.
example.tran: 就优点而言，他对母亲一直很孝顺。

entry.def: If something is to someone's credit, they deserve praise for it.

example.ex: She had managed to pull herself together and, to her credit, continued to look upon life as a positive experience...
example.tran: 她已经努力振作起来，而且值得称赞的是，她仍然积极乐观地看待生活。

example.ex: Although the offences were horrific it was to her credit that she had owned up.
example.tran: 她的犯罪手段很残忍，但她的供认不讳还是可以认可的。

entry.def: If you already have one or more achievements to your credit, you have achieved them.

example.ex: I have twenty novels and countless magazine stories to my credit.
example.tran: 我著有20部小说，还在杂志上发表了无数篇文章。

sentences.sentence: "he was given credit for his work"
"the credits were given at the end of the film"

means.word_mean: 2. money available for a client to borrow
3. an accounting entry acknowledging income or capital items
4. used in the phrase `to your credit' in order to indicate an achievement deserving praise;

sentences.sentence: "she already had several performances to her credit";

means.word_mean: 5. arrangement for deferred payment for goods and services
6. recognition by a college or university that a course of studies has been successfully completed; typically measured in semester hours
7. a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage;

sentences.sentence: "the student's essay failed to list several important citations"
"the acknowledgments are usually printed at the front of a book"
"the article includes mention of similar clinical cases"

means.word_mean: 8. an entry on a list of persons who contributed to a film or written work

sentences.sentence: "We credited her for saving our jobs"
"She was not properly credited in the program"

means.word_mean: 4. have trust in; trust in the truth or veracity of

stems_affixes.word_buile: cred相信+ible能……的→adj.可靠的,可信的
cred相信,信任+ulous多……的→相信太多→轻信的
in不+credulous[adj.轻信的,易信的]→adj.怀疑的, 不轻信的
cred相信,信任+ence表名词→相信
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
cred相信,信任+ential表形容词或名词→让人相信的东西→凭据
credulous[[adj.轻信的,易信的]]→n.易信, 轻信
in不+credulity[n.易信, 轻信]→n.怀疑
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
ac给予+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→给予相信→委托
dis不+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→v.不信任,怀疑

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"……人"; 2. 表抽象名词

herm孤独+it……人→n.隐士,修道者
pund学问+it……人→n.权威人士,专家
re再+cru成长+it……人→n.新兵,新分子,新会员 v.补充,征募,征募新兵,复原

stems_affixes.value_cn: 赤字,逆差;亏损,亏空;不足,缺乏

pursue追赶+it-it,表抽象名词→n.追赶,追求;职业,工作
spir呼吸,精神+it-it,表抽象名词→n.精神;志气;[n.]情绪,心情;[n.]酒精

stems_affixes.value_cn: 补充,征募,征募新兵,复原

cred信任+it表抽象名词→ v.信任;学分

Sentence.sentence: They are owned by individuals and by private businesses and corporations, lending institutions, direct mailing and telemarketing firms, credit bureaus, credit card companies, and government agencies at the local, state, and federal level.

They are owned by individuals and by private businesses and corporations, lending institutions, direct mailing and telemarketing firms, credit bureaus, credit card companies, and government agencies at the local, state, and federal level.
A recent survey by a credit bureau revealed that the number of alarmed citizens had shot up to 76 percent.
Government bonds are a secure investment because these bonds have the financial backing and full faith and credit of the federal government.

Scholars will debate which interventions this time - the Federal Reserve's support of a failing credit system, guarantees of bank debt, Obama's ''stimulus" plan and bank "stress test" - counted most in preventing a recurrence.
If this were a Hollywood movie, the courageous old Indiana farmer would beat the profit-minded corporation before the credits rolled.

sentences.en: This store does not give credit.
They established a credit for 100, 000 dollars in favour of me.
sentences.cn: 他们给我10万美元贷款来帮助我。

means.word_mean: 赞扬, 荣誉, 功劳

sentences.en: I gave her credit for being sensible.
She took credit for my work.
sentences.cn: 她把我的工作看作她的功劳。

sentences.en: Do you place any credit in the government's story?
He hasn't enough credits to get his degree.
sentences.cn: 他的学分不够取得学位。

sentences.en: She could not credit their statement.
sentences.cn: 她无法相信他们的声明。

sentences.en: I can barely credit what he said.
sentences.cn: 我简直不能相信他说的话。

means.word_mean: 把…记入贷方, 存入(账户)

sentences.en: The bank credited 50,000 dollars to us.
sentences.cn: 那家银行贷了五万元给我们。

sentences.en: She aways credited her distinctive character to her parents.
sentences.cn: 她总是把自己独特的性格归功于父母。

sentences.en: They credited me with three hours in history.
sentences.cn: 他们给了我三小时历史课的学分。

jushi.english: She was given no credit for her invention.
They established a credit for 10,000 dollars in favour of me.
jushi.chinese: 他们给我一万美元贷款来帮助我。

jushi.english: Our shop only allows people six months credit.
jushi.chinese: 我们商店只允许顾客赊欠半年。
